comment: Professor Wilson is a very nice guy and is really passionate about poetry. You have to read 8 of your poems in front of the class, so be prepared for that. At the end of the semester you have a final and you need revised poems, two more poems, and an essay. It feels like a lot but if you do the work then it's easy to get an A.

I strongly suggest to not take this class with this teacher, Although this professor is extremely nice and helpful, the class is so boring and there is only 3 tests for grading , so if you get bored in class and don't pay close enough attention to some boring readings you will fail the test and the class, he does give out extra credit but not much

This professor hands down is one of the best professors out there. He is very easygoing and relaxed. He cares for his students. There were chances to get extra credit, there were only three tests that he gave out. If you want to do well, pay attention to the reading, actually read the material, and go to class.

Does not give clear grading expectations. Test (midterm/final) had material that was not covered. Grading was unrealistic (I.e. Resume points deducted for not displaying full home address - he never discussed). Chips away minor points which adds up. Many students left disappointed. Does not update grades on D2L. Disorganized with high expectations.

There are 3 in-person exams (noncumulative), and all the notes you need for studying are on the PowerPoint he covers. In every lecture, he reviews the books you'll read and explains them chapter by chapter. He even told us which vocab terms would be on the exams. Dr. Wilson himself is extremely nice and genuinely cares.

Very fun class!! Most of the class is writing your own poems and then an exam, portfolio, and paper due at the end of the semester. It's a lot at once, but as long as you have your poems together and you've been studying the book given at the beginning of the semester, you will surely pass. The classes themselves are very fun and I'd take it again.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: lots of reading, both books and articles online, a paper due each week but it is short and just about your response and comprehension of the reading
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Dr. Wilson didn't set up firm guidlines on workshop etiquette. There was other students who were way to harsh which resulted in a toxic writing environment. He also doesn't post grades on D2L. He also cancelled class and only left a sign on the door. He didn't communicate with the class either about what we should expect during our next meeting.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Wilson himself is interesting and funny, but I'm not particularly interest in world lit and I took the class over summer so I was bored a lot. Readings are interesting and simple and you can find them online. 3 easy noncumulative exams and an easy required paper. Easily got an A and I simply went to class and copied down the ppts. Take him!

If unclear grading criteria in a course that should embody creativity & thought is your thing, take this class. But before you do, be sure to remember that personal writing styles are irrelevant. Just meet his standards for a "publishable poem" & you'll be golden. It's so hard to find profs. that balance subjectivity with the necessity of grading..

Took him over the 8 week summer session. 3 multiple choice tests, no papers. There is a textbook but its not really necessary as you can find the readings online. Attendance is important because he tells you exactly what you need for the tests. Hes pretty funny too!
Funny guy! I hate English classes, but this one was a joy. Prof Wilson is hilarious, makes the text relatable. No papers. 3 tests. 1 extra credit assignment. TAKE HIM!

I have taken this class this summer. It has been pretty good. There are 3 tests, and one extra credit opportunity. All you have to do is attend class, read the material, pay attention or take notes, and study. It is not super hard, but you should have to put in time studying! Mr. Wilson is chill and funny.

Professor Wilson is amazing! He makes reading literature fun! He compares the literature to our current century, to give an understanding of what the author means. You have to be in class to take notes. Summer session: 3 tests. The 3rd was considered the final, not cumulative. Highly recommend! Read book + take notes (attendance)  Easy A

Great teacher! I hated taking World Lit for the first time and after I dropped it, he made me love it! He is very nice and the test are very basic and easy if you go to class and take notes from a PP! Would most deff take again!

Easy AB course! Not bad! Only 3 tests and uses power points to explain the texts and does not post them online. Has an attendance policy so go to class to get a good grade. Also, he is boring and lectures are dry but easy comprehension from lectures. Tests are not bad! Sparknotes the text to understand them  Don't buy or rent the book!

He's AWESOME! Only 3 tests, no quizzes, essays, or projects. He uses power points and doesn't post them online so you must go to class but his exams are straight from the power points. For any world lit class this is amazing. I didn't even need to buy the books or read any of the assigned texts. The exams are easy if you take good notes.

Professor Wilson is a great professor. I had little interest prior to taking this class but he made it bearable. I took his class during the summer and it was a breeze. 3 tests and 1 extra credit assignment. Very possible to get an A in the class. Spark notes is your best friend

I love Dr. Wilson! He makes possibly one of the most boring subjects funny and interesting. I actually enjoyed going to class, which is mandatory. Actually reading the stories isn't even really necessary. Just take good notes and the exams will be a piece of cake. I wish I could take him for another class!

What an amazingly talented and knowledgable teacher. Only 3 tests and no other assignments so do the reading, take good notes, and study. You'll be just fine. I hope I have the opportunity to take another class with him.
Attendance is recommended since he doesn't put powerpoints online. We had 3 exams and one extra credit assignment. If you attend class and review your notes, you should come out with a decent grade.
Very kind professor. Class is dull, but he makes the tests very easy and basic. Easy A.

One of the kindest and most patient people I've ever met.Extremely humble and respectful of students despite his impressive accomplishments as a poet. We could miss five classes but I never wanted to. He is fantastic at leading discussions and super knowledgeable. The readings he chooses are interesting. Take this class! You won't regret it.

He is hilarious & goofy in the way that makes you want to pay attention. He obviously knows what he's talking about & uses "college kid lingo" to catch your attention. He's a great professor. I'm going to miss this class when it's over.
I would recommend him. I like the way he conducts the class. Nothing boring, and if you do your work/come to class, you'll do wonderfully.

I took Dr. Wilson over the summer.  Lots of reading (probably b/c summer is shorter) but the tests are straight from readings/notes in class.  He is very clear.  Show up for class, do the readings, take notes, read them a few times before the test and there is no reason you should not get an A or at least a B.  Great professor for a boring subject.
I thought I was going to learn a lot about poetry in this class... I got an A... woohoo. I'd take him again if I had to.

Attendance is mandatory, and you definitely need volume I of the textbooks for class because that is how you will do your homework (reader responses) which are due every class.  He is really funny, and he definitely gives you all of the info you need for the exams. Homework is a one page reader response which takes like 10 minutes to complete:)

Took this class cause I had to. All you have to do is go to class, take some notes, and do the reading responses and you will do well. He runs off topic sometimes and has interesting comments regarding the text. Would take him again if I had to.
I liked this class a lot. reminded me of going to the library for story time!  if you just show up for class you will make A's on all of his tests.  he is animated and really cool.  just show up!

I took Dr. Wilson for the first workshop class that I've ever taken and what a sour note to begin on. Even though I got an A, his idea of what "good poetry" is is limited to a seemingly shallow pool of his own mediocre work.

He was stubborn and single-minded. He is not open to different ideas or styles of writing. Grading is subjective to the point of being unfair. Undergraduate students were not a priority but a duty. Consistently late. My grade was "fair" in his mind but it was because of missed classes, which we had a previous agreement about. Do Not Take Him!

Great professor learned a lot fairly easy class lots of reading but no Term Paper. just reader responses to readings very easy only has to be a page. didn't study just read stories and listened to lectures got an A

He's very insightful, very open-minded and accepting of students' opinions and/or perceptions on the material presented. He's easy to speak to and doesn't get irritated if you question his opinions. Not too hard, but hard enough that you actually learn in his class. I would recommend him in any subject concerning Am. Lit and/or Poetry...he's top tier!
He was a good teacher and fairly easy as long as you do the readings and writings.
was a bit too picky on what should have been a mostly subjective course. Still a fun class though, always looked forward to it. I was angry though, that I worked so hard and only ended up with a B.

Nice teacher! Almost friend rather than prof. Do the assignments... they aren't hard. And as long as you do those as well as take part in the class discussions, which aren't too boring, and a few notes. Then you'll pass with an A! Easy easy class! and no papers!!!
Funny professor... Keeps class interesting and not bad to look at.
Extremely HOT prof.  Take any of his classes.  You'll never regret it!!!
It's a very boring subject but he makes it as interesting as it could possibly be. Just keep up with the readings
